comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3536) (MYAIR-3929)
#  1.  After successful sign-in, the App shall check with the server whether the patient has a device registered with their account.
#  2.  If App receives indication from the server that the patient has a device associated with their account, then the App shall allow the patient access to all signed-in functionality

#  3.  If App receives indication from the server that the patient has no device associated with their account, then the App shall require the patient register a device before they can access any signed-in functionality (Note: Patient can still logout)
#  4.  For device registration, the App shall request the following information from the patient:
#  a) Serial number
#  b) Device number
#  5.  The App shall inform the patient if the following validation criteria are not met for the serial number:
#  5a.	only contains digits from [0-9]
#  5b.	must be 11 characters in length
#  5c.	must exist
#  5d.	must exist in patient's region
#  5e.	must not match a serial number associated with an existing account
#  6.  The App shall inform the patient if the following validation criteria are not met for the device number:
#  6a.	only contains digits from [0-9]
#  6b.	must be 3 characters in length
#  6c.	must match the device number associated with serial number

#  Note: The same generic error message is to be displayed for the following scenarios: (5c) serial number does not exist (5e) serial number is associated with an existing account (6c) device number does NOT match the device number associated with serial number
#  7.  When the patient instructs the App to register a device, the App shall notify the server to register the device to the patient's account
#  8.  The App shall allow a patient to have only one (1) device registered with their account at any given time
# Testing Notes: "FG ID is not assigned to the account":
# In order to use this account we must delete this FG ID first from the Patient Portal and later check on myAir Web that this account does not have the FG assigned.
# "More" screen in iOS is analogous to "Settings" screen in android
# For Testing iOS we are going to use the Mock
# Navigate to Test Support >> Network >> Patient Portal >> Result Error Code >> "Missing FG"
# Confluence Page: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/V5+Patient+Portal+Endpoints#V5PatientPortalEndpoints-UpdateFlowGenerator

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

elements.name: The user's Device is deleted from the server. The user tries to update the Device with Serial Number already linked to another account.

steps.name: FG ID is not assigned to the account
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should be on the "Add machine" screen
I should see the "Serial number" field
I should see the "Device number" field
I enter "82922556863" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "564" into the "Device number" field
Patient Portal will return a "device already in use" response error code
I press "Save"
I should see the text "The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again."

arguments.val: The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again.

#  7.  When the patient instructs the App to register a device, the App shall notify the server to register the device to the patient's account

elements.name: The user's Device is deleted from the server. The user enters a valid Device Serial number and the app will update their new Device Serial number

steps.name: FG ID is not assigned to the account
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should be on the "Add machine" screen
I enter "78899898308" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "564" into the "Device number" field
I press "Save"
I should be on the "Add Mask" screen
I wait for network sync
I select "Full face" for Mask Type
I select "ResMed" for Mask Brand
I select "Mirage Quattro" for Mask Model
I tap the "Save Mask" button
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

elements.name: Verify when Monte Carlo receives 500 server error on Contact support screen, MC will inform user that server error occurred and user is able to dismiss the error message.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I input valid information in all "Contact support" fields
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "500"
I tap the "Submit" button
I should see the "Server Error" dialog
I'm able to dismiss the "Server Error" dialog
I tap the "Back"
I should be on the "myAir Support" screen

name: App Deprecation and Server Error from Patient Portal

name: No internet or Patient Portal Connection

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-4058) (MYAIR-4523)
# Registration Survey Questions
# 1. The user shall be able to view and update the month and year they started therapy.
# 2. The user shall be able to view and update how many events each hour their sleep test detected, from 0.0 up to and including 200.0, with one decimal place
# 3. The user shall be able to view and update where they had their sleep test as either Home or Sleep Lab, or both
# Post Registration Survey Questions
# 4. The user shall be able to view and update their setup for sleep therapy.
# 5. The user shall be able to view and update their reasons for treatment.
# 6. The user shall be able to view and update their BMI.
# 7. The user shall be able to view and update how sleepy they feel during the day prior to starting therapy.
# Note 1:  All test scenarios in this feature file require using Patient Portal server
# Note 2: "More" screen is for iOS and for android is "Settings"
# Note 3: "DONE" screen is for iOS and for android is "OK"

elements.name: Profile displays start therapy group and has no information on events per hour nor sleep test location after account creation and activation

steps.name: I create an account with "More than 1 year ago" as "Therapy start group"
I am signed in with this account
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
I select "My health" profile item
I should be on the "My health" screen
I should see the value "More than 1 year ago" in the "When did you start sleep therapy?" item

arguments.val: When did you start sleep therapy?

steps.name: I should see the value "Select" in the "How many events each hour did your sleep test detect?" item

arguments.val: How many events each hour did your sleep test detect?

steps.name: I should see the value "Select" in the "Where did you have your sleep test?" item

arguments.val: Where did you have your sleep test?

steps.name: I should see the value "Select" in the "How were you set up on therapy?" item

arguments.val: How were you set up on therapy?

steps.name: I should see the value "Select" in the "What best describes your reasons for treatment?" item

arguments.val: What best describes your reasons for treatment?

steps.name: I should see the value "Select" in the "Let's calculate your Body Mass Index (BMI)" item

arguments.val: Let's calculate your Body Mass Index (BMI)

steps.name: I should see the value "Select" in the "Prior to starting therapy, how sleepy did you usually feel during the day?" item

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when the user edits other fields on About me screen and updates new phone number, fields that were edited will show original values

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I enter "first" into the "First name" field
I enter "last" into the "Last name" field
I tap the "Cell phone" field
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "1234567890" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I press "Next"
I should be on the "Confirm cell phone" screen
I enter "CONFIRM" into the "Confirm cell phone" field
I press "Verify"
I should be on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the value "Jane" in the "First name" field
I should see the value "Doe" in the "Last name" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1306)
# 1. Given the user has not actioned the OS Push permission dialogue, when the user enables push in Monte Carlo, then Monte Carlo shall request Push permission from the phone
# 2. If Push is off in the phone settings for Monte Carlo, the user shall be instructed how to enable Push notifications in the phone settings
# Note: App must be launched for the first time after installation, where system push notifications is not yet enabled. This case does not apply to scenarios S2 and S3.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3421)
# 1. Given App Notifications are turned off in the phone settings, whenever a push setting is changed to enabled in the profile, myAir shall prompt the user to enable phone setting.
# 2. A user's push notification setting shall only show as enabled when both are true:
# a) App notifications in the phone settings is enabled
# b) The associated push setting in the profile is enabled

# Note: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user and for iOS default is assumed that App notifications are disabled unless User changes it.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: When user is requested to enable "Push Notifications" for the app on device and accept then "Push notifications" on the app should turn enabled

steps.name: notifications are disabled in System settings
I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Push notifications permission" dialog
I tap the "Allow" button
I should see the "Push notifications system" dialog
I tap the "Settings" button
I should be on the "App notification settings" screen
I "enable" notifications for the app on the device
I press "Back"
I should see the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
I dismiss the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the "Push notifications Coaching" switch is turned on
I should see the "Push notifications Cleaning Reminder" switch is turned on

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1306)
# 1. Given the user has not actioned the OS Push permission dialogue, when the user enables push in Monte Carlo, then Monte Carlo shall request Push permission from the phone
# 2. If Push is off in the phone settings for Monte Carlo, the user shall be instructed how to enable Push notifications in the phone settings
# Note: App must be launched for the first time after installation, where system push notifications is not yet enabled. This case does not apply to scenarios S2 and S3.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3421)
# 1. Given App Notifications are turned off in the phone settings, whenever a push setting is changed to enabled in the profile, myAir shall prompt the user to enable phone setting.
# 2. A user's push notification setting shall only show as enabled when both are true:
# a) App notifications in the phone settings is enabled
# b) The associated push setting in the profile is enabled

# Note: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user and for iOS default is assumed that App notifications are disabled unless User changes it.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: When user is requested to enable "Push Notifications" for the app on device and does not accept then "Push notifications" on the app should keep disabled

steps.name: notifications are disabled in System settings
I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Push notifications permission" dialog
I tap the "Allow" button
I should see the "Push notifications system" dialog
I tap the "Settings" button
I should be on the "App notification settings" screen
I press "Back"
I should not see the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the "Push notifications Coaching" switch is turned off
I should see the "Push notifications Cleaning Reminder" switch is turned off

# b) The associated push setting in the profile is enabled

I press "Back"

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1306)
# 1. Given the user has not actioned the OS Push permission dialogue, when the user enables push in Monte Carlo, then Monte Carlo shall request Push permission from the phone
# 2. If Push is off in the phone settings for Monte Carlo, the user shall be instructed how to enable Push notifications in the phone settings
# Note: App must be launched for the first time after installation, where system push notifications is not yet enabled. This case does not apply to scenarios S2 and S3.

# 2. A user's push notification setting shall only show as enabled when both are true:
# a) App notifications in the phone settings is enabled
# b) The associated push setting in the profile is enabled

# Note: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user and for iOS default is assumed that App notifications are disabled unless User changes it.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-502) (MYAIR-1060)
# 1. If the user is logged in, actioning a notification will open Monte Carlo to the appropriate screen
# 2. If the user is not logged in, they shall be moved to the login screen (note: default login action after logging in)
# 3. If the user actions a Coaching Push notification, the coaching section shall be updated
# Note 1: See https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Push%2C+Coaching+Tips+and+Library for details
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user
# IMPORTANT: need a clean install of the App

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings

elements.name: When user is logged in, opening notification will open appropriate type screen

I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
Push notifications are enabled
the app is in the background
a "ScoreTip" push notification is received with body "It's been a good week of therapy usage. The numbers on your dashboard prove it. See for yourself."

arguments.val: It's been a good week of therapy usage. The numbers on your dashboard prove it. See for yourself.

steps.name: I open the push notification
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1626) (MYAIR-1859)
# 1. On a 401 response from Patient Portal for the validation authentication key, Monte Carlo shall display a message indicating session has timed out and the user needs to re-login.
# Note: "Settings" screen is for android and "More" is for iOS

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

elements.name: Verify when the user is on the DashBoard screen, and signs into Monte Carlo on a different device using the same account, when the user refreshes the Coaching screen on the first device, then Monte Carlo session on the first device shall be timed out.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I wait for coaching sync
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "401"
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
I refresh the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Session timeout" dialog
I dismiss the "Session timeout" error message
I should be on the "Signin" screen

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: You can navigate backward and see the corresponding sleep scores.  Also when user navigates to Dashboard, the default sleep record displayed is the most recent sleep record because it has sleep data.

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I navigate to 1 sleep record back
I see the score for 1 sleep record ago
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores
I navigate to 2 sleep records back
I see the score for 3 sleep records ago
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores
I navigate to 1 sleep record back
I see the score for 4 sleep records ago
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores

name: Sleep Record Navigation and display default sleep record
